item.title: Comment on Zakaria on Rent Seeking by Zote
item.description:
California said the quiet part out loud when they banned SpaceX from launching explicitly because of Musk’s politics.

This is not a Trump problem. Progressives have weaponized institutions against meritocracy in general and people with forbidden politics in particular.

item.title: Comment on Zakaria on Rent Seeking by Roger Sweeny
item.description:
Reply to Zote:

California said the quiet part out loud when they banned SpaceX from launching explicitly because of Musk’s politics.

This is not a Trump problem. Progressives have weaponized institutions against meritocracy in general and people with forbidden politics in particular.

Which suggests an alternate/additional reason why the price of Musk's holdings went up. They wouldn't be targeted by Democrats/Progressives.

item.title: Comment on Zakaria on Rent Seeking by Tom T.
item.description:
Reply to Roger Sweeny:

Which suggests an alternate/additional reason why the price of Musk's holdings went up. They wouldn't be targeted by Democrats/Progressives.

More to the point, Musk's companies would stop getting targeted in so many ways by Biden's people. They would stop suing him for not hiring enough immigrants. The Fish and Wildlife Service would back off of its concern for his launch sites. The SEC would let go of its long war.

Also worth noting that Zakaria isn't speaking from principle; he has nothing to say when Biden's people were carrying out these attacks. He's just upset that the other tribe now has another opportunity to use these powers.

item.title: Comment on Another look at the New Jersey drone evidence by Max
item.description:
This is very obviously a case of mass hysteria being egged on by social media algorithms optimized for engagement and click bait headlines.

An awful lot of credulousness at MR of late...
